name: pulsation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of moving with a strong, regular rhythm: The star's pulsations cause it to brighten and dim every six minutes. Every blink of an eye or pulsation of a paramecium is powered by the protein ATP. See
pulsate
More examplesFewer examplesThe pulsation of Glass' music occasionally drives the dance in discernible ways.A digital to analogue converter turns digital pulsations into an analogue signal.Time-signatures seldom express the pulsations of his music.
